entry.title: Version 1.8.2
entry.content: Version 1.8.2 fixes a rare issue with parsing of KiCad generated gerber files

entry.title: Version 1.8.1
entry.content: Version 1.8.1 adds a new feature, which comes handy when working with aluminium core laminates – it allows to mill the contour of the board in several passes (along the Z axis). There’s a new parameter Max step in Contour milling settings – it specifies how deep the end mill can go in one pass. Code generator will then generate as many passes as needed to reach the specified Z level. Default value of 0 means the entire depth is milled in one pass.

entry.title: Version 2.0.0-RC6
entry.content: This version resolves a bug, which would cause spindle to move in all three axes in once after milling operation was stopped. Also, X travel range restored to its normal values (it has been broken along the way).

entry.title: Version 2.0.0-RC5
entry.content: Version 2.0.0-RC5 includes all the new features and bug fixes from the stable branch version 1.8.0, plus fixes a couple of bugs related to tool path generation introduced in the 2.0.x branch.

entry.title: Version 1.8.0
entry.content:
Version 1.8.0 comes with a brand new setup wizard, which helps to go through the necessary settings for the first setup of the program.

It also has included isolation milling tool library with all the default tools and their respective feeds and speeds.

As usually, we’ve squashed a bug or two along the way.

entry.title: Version 2.0.0-RC4
entry.content: Release candidate 4 improves controller and gcode error handling. In addition, it includes all the good stuff of the stable branch up to version 1.7.11

entry.title: Version 1.7.11
entry.content: This version addresses dispensing tool paths generation on pads defined using aperture macros

entry.title: Version 2.0.0-RC3
entry.content: The new release candidate fixes a communication problem that some of our Windows users experienced. We’ll follow up with some UI improvements shortly and version 2.0 will graduate to release.

entry.title: Version 1.7.10
entry.content: First release of 2018, version 1.7.10 comes with some optimizations in rub out generation algorithm. It's no match to the rub out in release candidate of version 2.0, but still a welcome improvement for those, who aren't ready for version 2.0

entry.title: Version 1.7.9
entry.content: This version takes care of the bug, which was unintentionally introduced in version 1.7.6 – under certain circumstances Y offset was not calculated and this lead to Run button being disabled on milling and drilling screens.

entry.title: Version 1.7.8
entry.content: This version fixes macro outlines rotation issues.

entry.title: Version 1.7.7
entry.content: This version addresses yet another issue with Gerber files parsing

entry.title: Version 1.7.6
entry.content: As requested by some our users, version 1.7.6 adds a larger panel size – 100×205mm. Given this overlaps with components panel area on Cirqoid, using panel of this size makes pick and place operation impossible.

entry.title: Version 2.0.0-RC1
entry.content:
This is the first release candidate of version 2.0. The main focus was on improving tool path generation algorithms. Both isolation milling and rub out tool paths are now much more coherent and take way less time to be generated.

This version also changes the way cirQWizard communicates with the controller. Thus, it requires update of Cirqoid’s firmware to version 0.3.×. Keep in mind, that firmware 0.3.x won’t be compatible with previous versions of cirQWizard (though it’s still possible to downgrade firmware if you want to go back to the previous version).

Recommended update procedure is to update the firmware first and then proceed with cirQWizard’s update.

Also, as the name suggests – this is a release candidate. It’s quite possible some bugs are still there. If you happen to stumble upon one of them, drop us a note and will take care of that. The best place for dropping that note is cirQWizard’s forum.

entry.title: Version 1.7.5
entry.content: This version fixes a few with Orcad generated Gerber files.

entry.title: Version 1.7.4
entry.content: Version 1.7.4 is a feature update – it introduces functionality for dispensing solder paste and placing components on both sides of the board (earlier versions only allowed these operations on the top layer).

entry.title: Version 1.7.3
entry.content: This version fixes another Excellon parsing bug, which was introduced in one of the previous versions – CQ-204

entry.title: Version 1.7.2
entry.content:
Version 1.7.2 adds a possibility to override default setting for leading/trailing zeros omission – Excellon format allows to omit either leading or trailing zeros in the coordinates, but does not require to specify which ones were omitted. Inevitably, different EDAs approach this differently.

This new setting can be found in Settings → Import, under Excellon tab

entry.title: Version 1.7.1
entry.content:
Previous version came out rather beefy, so in this version we shaved down some excess weight. We also squashed a couple of bugs, while we were at it:

Release Notes – cirQWizard – Version 1.7.1

Bug

  • [CQ-199] – Single quadrant arcs are not parsed correctly
  • [CQ-201] – Outline macro are not properly displayed

Improvement

  • [CQ-197] – Optimize release size

entry.title: Version 1.7.0
entry.content: Version 1.7.0 adds support for camera assisted components placement. Check out microscope add-on for Cirqoid
